intro: Drypis linneana, commonly known as the Linnean drypis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, compound umbels of small white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a fern-like appearance, contributing to its ornamental value. Drypis linneana is known for its aromatic foliage and is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
